fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique ID for the object

val.name: ID
val.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON
response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

val.name: String
val.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

val.name: Int
val.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric
values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

val.name: Avatar
val.description: Avatars are profile images for users. WordPress by default uses the Gravatar service to host and fetch avatars from.

fields.name: default
fields.description: URL for the default image or a default type. Accepts '404' (return a 404 instead of a default image), 'retro' (8bit), 'monsterid' (monster), 'wavatar' (cartoon face), 'indenticon' (the 'quilt'), 'mystery', 'mm', or 'mysteryman' (The Oyster Man), 'blank' (transparent GIF), or 'gravatar_default' (the Gravatar logo).

fields.name: extraAttr
fields.description: HTML attributes to insert in the IMG element. Is not sanitized.

fields.name: forceDefault
fields.description: Whether to always show the default image, never the Gravatar.

fields.name: foundAvatar
fields.description: Whether the avatar was successfully found.

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height of the avatar image.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: rating
fields.description: What rating to display avatars up to. Accepts 'G', 'PG', 'R', 'X', and are judged in that order.

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: Type of url scheme to use. Typically HTTP vs. HTTPS.

fields.name: size
fields.description: The size of the avatar in pixels. A value of 96 will match a 96px x 96px gravatar image.

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL for the gravatar image source.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Width of the avatar image.

fields.name: public
fields.description: Whether the taxonomy is publicly queryable

fields.name: restBase
fields.description: Name of content type to diplay in REST API "wp/v2" namespace.

fields.name: restControllerClass
fields.description: The REST Controller class assigned to handling this content type.

fields.name: showCloud
fields.description: Whether to show the taxonomy as part of a tag cloud widget. This field is equivalent to WP_Taxonomy->show_tagcloud

fields.name: showInAdminColumn
fields.description: Whether to display a column for the taxonomy on its post type listing screens.

fields.name: showInGraphql
fields.description: Whether to add the post type to the GraphQL Schema.

fields.name: showInMenu
fields.description: Whether to show the taxonomy in the admin menu

fields.name: showInNavMenus
fields.description: Whether the taxonomy is available for selection in navigation menus.

fields.name: showInQuickEdit
fields.description: Whether to show the taxonomy in the quick/bulk edit panel.

fields.name: showInRest
fields.description: Whether to add the post type route in the REST API "wp/v2" namespace.

fields.name: showUi
fields.description: Whether to generate and allow a UI for managing terms in this taxonomy in the admin

fields.name: metaFields
fields.description: Added to the GraphQL Schema because the ACF Field Group "Meta Fields" was set to Show in GraphQL.

fields.name: themeGeneralSettings
fields.description: Added to the GraphQL Schema because the ACF Field Group "Theme General Settings" was set to Show in GraphQL.

fields.name: author
fields.description: Name of the theme author(s), could also be a company name. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "Author" ).

fields.name: authorUri
fields.description: URI for the author/company website. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "AuthorURI" ).

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the theme. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "Description" ).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier of the theme object.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: name
fields.description: Display name of the theme. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "Name" ).

fields.name: screenshot
fields.description: The URL of the screenshot for the theme. The screenshot is intended to give an overview of what the theme looks like. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get_screenshot().

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The theme slug is used to internally match themes. Theme slugs can have subdirectories like: my-theme/sub-theme. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get_stylesheet().

fields.name: tags
fields.description: URI for the author/company website. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "Tags" ).

fields.name: themeUri
fields.description: A URI if the theme has a website associated with it. The Theme URI is handy for directing users to a theme site for support etc. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "ThemeURI" ).

fields.name: version
fields.description: The current version of the theme. This field is equivalent to WP_Theme->get( "Version" ).

fields.name: capabilities
fields.description: The capabilities that belong to this role

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The display name of the role

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier for the user role object.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: name
fields.description: The registered name of the role

fields.name: appointments
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the appointment type

fields.name: articles
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the article type

fields.name: avatar
fields.description: Avatar object for user. The avatar object can be retrieved in different sizes by specifying the size argument.

fields.name: businesses
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the business type

fields.name: capKey
fields.description: User metadata option name. Usually it will be "wp_capabilities".

fields.name: capabilities
fields.description: A list of capabilities (permissions) granted to the user

fields.name: comments
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the Comment type

fields.name: databaseId
fields.description: Identifies the primary key from the database.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the user.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email address of the user. This is equivalent to the WP_User->user_email property.

fields.name: enqueuedScripts
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the EnqueuedScript type

fields.name: enqueuedStylesheets
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the EnqueuedStylesheet type

fields.name: events
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the event type

fields.name: extraCapabilities
fields.description: A complete list of capabilities including capabilities inherited from a role. This is equivalent to the array keys of WP_User->allcaps.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: First name of the user. This is equivalent to the WP_User->user_first_name property.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The globally unique identifier for the user object.

fields.name: isContentNode
fields.description: Whether the node is a Content Node

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether the object is restricted from the current viewer

fields.name: isTermNode
fields.description: Whether the node is a Term

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: Last name of the user. This is equivalent to the WP_User->user_last_name property.

fields.name: locale
fields.description: The preferred language locale set for the user. Value derived from get_user_locale().

fields.name: mediaItems
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the mediaItem type

fields.name: name
fields.description: Display name of the user. This is equivalent to the WP_User->dispaly_name property.

fields.name: nicename
fields.description: The nicename for the user. This field is equivalent to WP_User->user_nicename

fields.name: nickname
fields.description: Nickname of the user.

fields.name: ourpeoples
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the ourpeople type

fields.name: pages
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the page type

fields.name: posts
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the post type

fields.name: registeredDate
fields.description: The date the user registered or was created. The field follows a full ISO8601 date string format.

fields.name: revisions
fields.description: Connection between the User and Revisions authored by the user

fields.name: roles
fields.description: Connection between the User type and the UserRole type

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The slug for the user. This field is equivalent to WP_User->user_nicename

fields.name: uri
fields.description: The unique resource identifier path

fields.name: url
fields.description: A website url that is associated with the user.

fields.name: username
fields.description: Username for the user. This field is equivalent to WP_User->user_login.

fields.name: arePrettyPermalinksEnabled
fields.description: Returns wether or not pretty permalinks are enabled.

fields.name: gatsbyPreviewStatus
fields.description: The current status of a Gatsby Preview.

fields.name: isPreviewFrontendOnline
fields.description: Wether or not the Preview frontend URL is online.

fields.name: defaultCategory
fields.description: Default post category.

fields.name: defaultPostFormat
fields.description: Default post format.

fields.name: useSmilies
fields.description: Convert emoticons like :-) and :-P to graphics on display.

fields.description: The name of the ACF Field Group
